title: Check Disk Usage by User
description: Find the disk usage of a specific user
scenario: Check how much disk space the user 'alice' is using.
hints: Use du to check disk usage

title: Add New User
scenario: Create a new user called 'bob' on the system.
hints: Use adduser or useradd to create a user

title: Restart Service
scenario: Restart the nginx service using systemctl.
hints: Try typing: sudo systemctl restart nginx

title: Enable Service at Boot
description: Enable a service to start at boot
scenario: Ensure the ssh service starts automatically on system boot.
hints: Use systemctl enable to start a service at boot
The ssh service is commonly called 'ssh'
Try typing: sudo systemctl enable ssh

title: Disable Service at Boot
description: Prevent a service from starting automatically
scenario: Prevent the apache2 service from starting automatically on boot.
hints: Use systemctl disable to stop a service at boot
The apache2 service is commonly called 'apache2'
Try typing: sudo systemctl disable apache2

title: Check Service Status
description: Check if a service is active
scenario: Check the current status of the ssh service.
hints: Use systemctl status to see service details
The ssh service is commonly called 'ssh'

title: List Users
description: List all users on the system
scenario: Display a list of all user accounts on the system.
hints: Use cut to extract the first field (username)

title: Modify File Permissions
scenario: Give read, write, and execute permissions to the owner for file.sh.

title: Change File Ownership
description: Assign a file to a different user
scenario: Change the owner of data.txt to user 'alice'.
hints: Try typing: sudo chown alice data.txt

title: Monitor Disk Space
scenario: Display disk usage of all mounted partitions.
hints: Use df to check disk usage

title: Lock a User Account
description: Prevent a user from logging in
scenario: Lock the account of user 'bob' to prevent login.
hints: Use usermod with -L to lock a user

title: Unlock a User Account
description: Allow a previously locked user to login
hints: Use usermod with -U to unlock a user

title: View Last Logins
scenario: Display the last login records of all users.
hints: Use the last command to see login history
It shows username, terminal, IP, and login time

title: Check Running Processes
scenario: List all running processes with detailed information.
hints: Use ps aux to list all processes
It shows user, CPU, memory, and command

title: Check Memory Usage
scenario: Check total, used, and free memory on the system.
